content.title: Pancreaticoduodenal Artery Aneurysm
content.description: Rare visceral aneurysm typically developing as collateral pathway when celiac axis is stenosed.

clinical_features.pathophysiology: High flow through collateral pathway leads to aneurysmal degeneration
clinical_features.association: Strong association with MALS or celiac stenosis/occlusion

treatment.key_principle: Must address underlying celiac stenosis if present

content.clinical_pearl: Treating the aneurysm without addressing celiac stenosis will fail; restore normal pancreaticoduodenal arcade flow
content.statement: Pancreaticoduodenal Artery Aneurysm is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Mesenteric that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Pancreaticoduodenal Artery Aneurysm helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Pancreaticoduodenal Artery Aneurysm include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Pancreaticoduodenal Artery Aneurysm.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Pancreaticoduodenal Artery Aneurysm. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
